info.title: Orders
info.description: Provides methods for working with order processing and settings.

get.description: Retrieves an array of Order Types.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Order Type objects.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves a Price Group based on a valid Price Group ID.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**priceGroupId**
- Get Price Groups

parameters.name: priceGroupId
parameters.description: The Id of the Price Group to retrieve.

200.description: Returns a valid Price Group object.

404.description: A Price Group with the given Price Group ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves list of unshipped packages.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**warehouseId**
- Products: Get Regions

200.description: Returns a list of unshipped packages.

put.description:
Given a Package ID, sets the package status to shipped, and updates tracking number and carrier of the specified package. Note: To update the shipped status and tracking info using an Order Number, see API call "Set Order Shipped".

Carrier and Tracking Number are required fields (see the Request JSON below). The "Carrier" field is a loosely-typed indicator used to identify the shipping entity. This can be used in custom code to tie the tracking number to a specific carrier (for generating links, etc.) 

Note: Currently, Disco neither manages nor displays "Carrier" anywhere in the base product. It is stored as an open field in table ORD_OrderPackages, and is returned in the "Get Orders" API response.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at this call:

**packageId**
- Get Order

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The shipping carrier and tracking number.

**Required Fields:**
- Carrier
   - Not provided by DirectScale
- TrackingNumber
   - Not provided by DirectScale

200.description: Package shipping status was successfully updated.

put.description:
Set the package status to returned.  This method is used to notify the order processing system that the package was returned by an external system.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at this call:

**packageId**
- Get Order

200.description: Package was successfully marked as returned.

get.description:
Get the details for a package within an order.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**orderId**
- Get Order IDs
- Get Order IDs by Filter

**packageId**
- Get Order
   - Can be found labeled as ``PackagerNumber`` or under the ``Packages`` array at ``ID``.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The Order number for the given order

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: The package id for the given package

200.description: Returns the details of a package.

404.description: Given order or package was not found.

post.description:
Import an order that has been processed by an external system. This API will import the order data for commission calculations only. It is assumed that all processing, billing, and shipping of goods for the order has being done by an external system.

PREVIEW: Please note that this method is still under development.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields:**
- CustomerId
   - Get Customers
   - Get Customer by Filter
- ExternalOrderId
   - Not sourced by DirectScale
- CommissionDate
   - Not sourced by DirectScale

**Uniqueness Required:**
- ExternalOrderId

put.description:
Given an Order ID, sets the package status to shipped, and updates tracking number and carrier of all packages in an order. 

Carrier and Tracking Number are required fields (see the Request JSON below). The "Carrier" field is a loosely-typed indicator used to identify the shipping entity. This can be used in custom code to tie the tracking number to a specific carrier (for generating links, etc.) 

Note: Currently, Disco neither manages nor displays "Carrier" anywhere in the base product. It is stored as a non-FK field in table ORD_OrderPackages, and is returned in the "Get Orders" API response.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**orderId**
- Get Order IDs
- Get Order IDs by Filter

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The OrderId of the order for which you want to set package status shipped.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields:**
- Carrier
   - Not provided by DirectScale
- TrackingNumber
   - Not provided by DirectScale

200.description: Package shipping status was successfully updated for all packages in order.
Returns an array of Order IDs

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Gets all Order IDs that meet the specified criteria.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**orderType**
- Get Order Type(s)

**orderCreatedBeginDate**
- Get Order

**Date + Time format**

Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second
- Ex. 2020-02-20T15:47:52

200.description: Returns an array of Order IDs that matched the filter criteria.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields:**
- orderId
   - Get Order
   - Get Order Package Details

post.description: Refund a payment on an order.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields:**
- OrderNumber
   - Get Order
   - Get Order Package Details
- Refunds
   - PaymentID
      - Get Order
   - Amount
      - Get Order
      - Get Order Package Details

get.description:
Get RMAs for an order.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**orderId**
- Get Order IDs
- Get Order IDs by Filter

post.description:
Inserts a payment into the Payments table.

**WARNING:** This call does **not** have validation, so as long as the array variables are present, the call will create the desired item, no matter the fields missing.
**NOTE:** Here are the potential ``status`` options:
- Accepted
- Pending
- Redirect
- Rejected
- NotProvided
- PendingPreCheck
- PendingFraudReview
- FraudRejected

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves an Autoship template based on a valid Autoship ID. An autoship is a template for an order that's executed on a regular basis. This can be used for product, service, or subscription sales orders.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at this call: **autoshipId** - Customers: Get Customer Autoships

parameters.name: autoshipId
parameters.description: ID of the autoship template to be fetched

LineItems.Description: Can't seem to get in touch with your surroundings? This bottled form of The Force allows you the power of a jedi with the same ease as a Febreeze aerosol can!

Languages.Description: Can't seem to get in touch with your surroundings? This bottled form of The Force allows you the power of a jedi with the same ease as a Febreeze aerosol can!

put.description:
Triggers the statistics engine to calculate user metrics for a particular order, and all upline members impacted by the purchase. It triggers an entire stats rebuild for those impacted by the purchase.

This happens automatically for regular purchases (those made using "Create Customer Order"). When "Import External Order" is used, or another method is used to put an order in the system, for stats to process the order and impact current user metrics, this call can be used.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls:

**orderId**
- Get Order IDs
- Get Order IDs by Filter
- The Order ID is also returned from the Create Customer Order call, and can be input here

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The OrderId of the order for which you want to set package status shipped.

200.description: Package shipping status was successfully updated for all packages in order.
